24EAFB1574BD47498D96434E523FBE2D.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading, and being read to, and responding to texts, including using adjectives and adverbs to describe (e.g., When other kids are happy that makes me happy).

53622249A6A947F999F8C1B35FCF2346.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related verbs (e.g., toss, throw, hurl) and closely related adjectives (e.g., thin, slender, skinny, scrawny)

D151F6949F304389956374C406478C28.description: Use words for identification and description, making connections between words and their use (e.g., describe foods that are spicy or juicy)

03E35A5E5C294203BE5EC7F43C78D4D5.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use.

7F58D3E772394A3E83DF52B786253261.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

753F5FF03E4C4186BA570AC28A484480.description: Use glossaries and beginning dictionaries to determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases.Â

683404AF4CC846758698FC8F9FABC91A.description: Use knowledge of the meaning of individual words to predict the meaning of compound words (e.g., birdhouse, lighthouse, housefly, bookshelf, notebook, bookmark)

CBD0F1C4A3354EA0ADF9600392D9469E.description: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., addition, additional)

2A7089A1CD7D46ECBED7F6186875E49B.description: Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known prefix is added to a known word (e.g., happy/unhappy, tell/retell)

C88C013A58024D11A7BF7A867AC652D4.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

172AE4614FB845DE93E0DE8163E682F0.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple meaning words and phrases, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

C3561A3309A14A2C9670B177CD89F1D5.description: Compare academic and conversational uses of English.

BBBE436031874AFDA7F5E3F8BCFD781B.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

15EA297B27CF420893A28BEC47BC9E8A.listId: Speaking and Listening- Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
15EA297B27CF420893A28BEC47BC9E8A.description: Express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly, adapting language according to context.

4B62F43CDE9B476A8D4ECF238CCB61C7.listId: Speaking and Listening- Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
4B62F43CDE9B476A8D4ECF238CCB61C7.description: Include digital media and/or visual displays in presentations to clarify or support ideas, thoughts, and feelings

85DE059220EB4CA680ACA3572A4043A6.listId: Speaking and Listening- Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
85DE059220EB4CA680ACA3572A4043A6.description: Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings clearly

AADC3EDFE2654801BC85EBB9671DDE5C.description: Develop and answer questions about what a speaker says; agree or disagree with the speaker's point of view, providing a reason(s).

5600F3A381C74DF6920CD2A6FF935DEA.listId: Speaking and Listening- Comprehension and Collaboration
5600F3A381C74DF6920CD2A6FF935DEA.description: Recount or describe key ideas or details of diverse texts and formats.

3DA9ED44F355407CAA879E447661C70D.description: Consider individual differences when communicating with others.

5CE7A5D39BFF407EA466E7BF58E44D3B.description: Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed about topics and texts under discussion.

2AF1D83C0AF9405DB4E9A19A4B9BC9D0.description: Build on others' talk in conversations by linking their comments to the remarks of others through multiple exchanges

012085BEA692434FA1406C7687C75D3C.description: Follow agreed upon rules for discussions and participate by actively listening, taking turns, and staying on topic.

3773A4CAB94D4CE99C655997973E921F.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse peers and adults in small and large groups and during play.

E6F1D304EB1E4A49A9605C7F3ED8AC07.listId: Writing- Research to Build and Present Knowledge
E6F1D304EB1E4A49A9605C7F3ED8AC07.description: Recall and represent relevant information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

06D5C650FF284452953B55F71ABA4EF5.listId: Writing- Research to Build and Present Knowledge
06D5C650FF284452953B55F71ABA4EF5.description: Develop questions and participate in shared research and explorations to answer questions and to build knowledge.

6FC7E55093F640899A6025A61F3E443B.description: Create a response to a text, author, theme or personal experience (e.g. poem, play, story, artwork, or other)

2701202B7A1E49F1B2047D5DCD48D270.description: Write narratives which recount real or imagined experiences or a short sequence of events, including details to describe actions, thoughts, and feelings; use temporal words to signal event order, and provide a sense of closure.

9B72F58CC4974C559E4198B353160EC4.description: Write informative/explanatory texts that introduce a topic, use facts and other information to develop points, use content-specific language, and provide a concluding statement or section.

029700FCDC524347B48C782604FCB606.description: Write an opinion about a topic or personal experience, using clear reasons and relevant evidence.

A23CACCFFDC449B1A5CBFAE155DFEDA9.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

54137D7C246F41E29D6F8AE8A39095C8.description: Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, an expression on successive readings.

4C8373F4D8C5463EB59EAEFFD5892AC5.description: Read grade-level text with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension

C5853397AE8A474DB0081FCAEC3F94A8.description: Read all common high-frequency words by sight.

260E9680A30A4E49B346EFEA4FA5E7B0.description: Recognize and identify root words and common suffixes and prefixes.

BF104A4A28174A229F02092B861F073E.description: Decode short and long vowel sounds in two-syllable words.

D6A03461493B4A5ABF198CDEE9BF6CED.description: Distinguish long and short vowels when reading regularly spelled one-syllable words (including vowel teams)

D39FA2EE23A445ACBB025838EAE34305.listId: Foundational Skills- Phonics and Word Recognition
D39FA2EE23A445ACBB025838EAE34305.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

C452F84263BB46D19793BD0C16D2A9E0.description: Explain how specific points the author or illustrator makes in a text are supported by relevant reasons. (RI&RL)

A7AF2C1586844F1D87135D8152B87BBC.description: Demonstrate understanding of story elements and/or topics by applying information gained from illustrations or text features (RI&RL)

742A5BEE82414EA997E89B79130C184E.description: Describe the overall structure of a text, including describing how the beginning introduces the text and the ending concludes the text (RI&RL)

706F649535204F858FD215108398D559.listId: Literary and Informational Text - Craft and Structure
706F649535204F858FD215108398D559.description: Explain how words and phrases in a text suggest feelings and appeal to the senses (RI&RL)

AF0D6DB00B4046119102A5C9AFE41E04.description: In literary texts, describe how characters respond to major events and challenges (RL). In informational texts, describe the connections between ideas, concepts, or a series of events (RI)

7C94D5D18C074A669DC0A0C7AB6F0D8F.description: Identify a main topic or central idea and retell key details in a text; summarize portions of a text. (RI&RL)
